result.execSummary:
The defendant David S Lindsey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber for employment, counseling and childcare if approved by jail administration. 
First half must be in jail, the 2nd half can be on Electronic Monitoring if approved by jail administration and RISK assessment.

miscConds.notes:
Pay fine of $200 plus costs including the drug abuse surcharge. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Work fulltime, go to school fulltime or combination for fulltime.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

All medications from the same pharmacy. 
Sign all necessary releases to monitor his case specifically for medical and medication purposes. 
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by his agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David S Lindsey in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:38 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF421 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
15CF9 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Atty Schmidt agrees with prior conviction for THC. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF421 Count 1, 15CF9.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Convictions this date.
14CF421 Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Schmidt makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
14CF421 Count 1 - 
180 days jail -STAYED-
3 days credit.
Huber for employment, counseling and childcare if approved by jail administration. 
First half must be in jail, the 2nd half can be on electronic monitoring if approved by jail administration and the RISK assessment.
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months: 
Pay fine of $200 plus costs and the drug abuse surcharge (No DNA).
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
All medications from the same pharmacy.
Sign all necessary releases to monitor his case specifically for medical and medication purposes. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Work fullitme, go to school fulltime or combination for fulltime.
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by his agent.

15CF9
100 days jail, consecutive to any sentence he is serving -STAYED-
5 days credit. 
Huber for employment, counseling and childcare if approved by jail administration. 
First half must be in jail, the 2nd half can be on electronic monitoring if approved by jail administration and the RISK assessment.
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months, concurrent:
Comply with all conditions set forth in 14CF421. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.
Jury trial at 10-22-2015 08:00 am

Court questions defendant as to why he did not resond to any of his attorney's attempt to contact him.
Court reviews bond on file.

Court will set a new trial date.

BY THE COURT:

15CF9 bond remains at $250
Go to day report on all days he is in court.
